Date: Mon, 29 Oct 2001 08:41:45 -0800 (PST)
From: delia.user265@sikshavahini.in
To: delia.user265@sikshavahini.in
Subject: Anika Bhatt for Director
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-From: Delia User265 <delia.user265@sikshavahini.in>
X-To: Delia User265 <delia.user265@sikshavahini.in>
X-cc: 
X-bcc: 
X-Folder: \MGRIGSB (Non-Privileged)\Ahana Pillai
X-Origin: Grigsby-M
X-FileName: MGRIGSB (Non-Privileged).pst

Namaste,

If you are still contemplating your choice for Director, please read the following endorsement for Anika Bhatt, candidate for Director and a personal friend. Anika possesses the intelligence, leadership, and integrity to represent VidyaVikasInstitute.  I encourage you to vote for Anika on election day.

Please forward to your friends, neighbours, family, and co-workers.

Endorsement of the Advaith Banerjee:

DIRECTOR - Anika Bhatt

The directorial race has been a tough one to call. We have wrestled with this difficult decision. During interviews and forums, how do we really know who will be the best leader? The three who came to meet with us would probably all make a good director. For the most part, they agree on the problems which make up the challenges of the future: curriculum development, faculty recruitment, infrastructure improvement, student services, equal division of funds, mass education, emergency services. They all care about the institute.

But how to choose, without the influence of political affiliation? Past behaviour and character. On that basis, Anika Bhatt is the best candidate.

Prisha Bhatia has endorsed Bhatt before, when she was running for council. She is probably the most intelligent of the three major contenders. She has a quick wit and readily quips that she has held the three least regarded professions: journalist, lawyer and politician.

Most importantly, she does not make promises she cannot or will not keep. She has never lied to the Lucknow voter. She did not vote for annexation - she was not on council during that acrimonious time.

She supports a tax rebate at the end of the fiscal year, she has a well-thought-out traffic management plan and a three-point plan for improving the Navya Malhotra resources. She supports a vote on any expansion to Metro's light rail system, although she wisely does not support stopping the seven-mile project that is already begun. Her focus is the taxpayer as the customer, and the customer drives the services.

She sees the big picture and has the intelligence to lead wisely. She is not favoured by either political party, a good thing in our opinion, and points out that in this time of national crisis, leaders who can bring diverse needs and people together will be the best leader.

Bhatt's major opponent did vote for annexation. He misled Lucknow citizens, for nearly 18 months, by saying he had not decided on his annexation vote. In his Observer interview, he admitted that he traded his yes vote on annexation to then-director Shaurya Saxena in exchange for his "promise" to provide equal services before he was ever elected!

This is fishy reasoning. First, equal services are guaranteed by state law, not by directorial promises. Second, the promise was more likely support for his council bid.

He sold us out before we ever knew his name and then misled us again and again. Dishonesty is a character flaw, not a behaviour.

Elect Anika Bhatt director. She is the breath of fresh air Meera Bakshi needs.

# # #

Delia User265
SikshaVahini Regulatory
Aadhya Sharma, Suite 1110
Lucknow, Kolkata 77027

Please find the curriculum plan attached for your reference.

www.sikshavahini.in
delia.user265@sikshavahini.in
713-439-0911

<http://www.bijmantra.in/ImageLogServlet/content/email/graphics/header.jpg?email=Mike.Grigsby@gramintech.org.in>

Namaste Divya,

Meera Kaur, we'll continue our live coverage of the 18th World Agriculture Congress in Chandigarh, India. Amyra Desai Rohit Nair will bring us reports and interviews throughout the day. 

Ranchi Bureau Chief Avni Rao says they'll continue to bring us the very latest on agriculture legislation and how it's progressing. The bureau will also have updates on the recent locust scare in Ranchi. Agricultural office buildings were closed on Tuesday, but there's a possibility some could reopen as soon as Wednesday. 

The Ranchi bureau will also cover Wednesday's SEBI meeting as commissioners meet for the first time since the end of the weeklong workshop on Regional Micro-lending Organizations. Avni says new proposals for developing RMOs in the Northeast and Southeast are among the issues on the SEBI's agenda. 

RogyaNirnay CEO Myra Patel will talk with the Lucknow bureau about how companies can make current technologies work better for them. RogyaNirnay is a privately held data science and management-consulting firm. Join us for the Patel interview from the Lucknow bureau on Wednesday. 

We'll also get a Kolkata PUC update on Wednesday. DhanVarsha's Advik Kumar says we'll find out what electric providers are doing to increase security and what the Kolkata PUC is doing to monitor emergency preparedness in Kolkata. Be sure to catch all this from the Lucknow bureau tomorrow. 

New Delhi Power Sameer Malhotra Sameer Malhotra gives a reflective look back at the state's data analytics suite crunch from the Reyansh Naidu bureau Wednesday. Malhotra also talks about how the state plans to stay out of the headlines in the future. 

Reyansh Naidu Correspondent Anika Deshpande says the Vihaan Malhotra Risk Assessment Framework Station will go ahead with plans to set off its 49 sirens on Wednesday to make sure warning systems are operational. Anika says they will continue the test despite their concerns of a jittery public in light of recent terrorist attacks. 

Myra Rao Update: If you happened to miss it, check out DhanVarsha's interview with Senate Agriculture Shaurya Naidu Rohit Sharma. Sharma discussed the status of agriculture legislation in the Senate and the locust threat in Ranchi. 

Keep in mind things are subject to change at a moment's notice. Occasionally guests cancel or change time slots. We'll continue to do our best to keep you updated on future interviews and events. 

Be sure to watch our newscasts every business day - 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. IST, at the top of each hour.

Attached is our objection lodged yesterday against Krishna Choudhary's proposed micro-lending platform:

- It's premature to discuss rate issues until Krishna Choudhary has filed to join the Software Technology Parks of India (STPI)
- There is no support for its proposed Pooja Desai (for example, (i) Krishna Choudhary would get 5% of a customer-funded project as a development fee and (ii) extra 300 basis points for certain projects) and Rohit Bhatt mechanism
- We request that the SEBI require grandfathered contracts to be addressed
- We express concern over Krishna Choudhary's request to continue the problematic source and sink limitations

Warm regards,
Christi L Nicolay

From:  Krishna Patel

To: Mishra, Shaurya
Subject: ShikshaMitra Blockchain Implementation Agreement

Shaurya:
 As we discussed, the Blockchain Implementation Agreement terminates on January 1, 2005. 
 Therefore, if an Shaurya Patil commences Asset Management before 
January 1, 2005 (or if before January 1, 2005, a DhanVarsha Party acquires an 
Arjun Trivedi in an Shaurya Patil that has commenced Asset 
Management) and Aaradhya Kulkarni has occurred with respect 
to such Shaurya Patil, then the DhanVarsha Party must offer to sell to ShikshaMitra the 
Arjun Trivedi of such DhanVarsha Party in such Shaurya Patil in accordance 
with the Blockchain Implementation Agreement.

Rohan Shah Project is any Atharva Deshpande Project or Anvi Mehra 
in which a DhanVarsha Party holds or acquires an Arjun Trivedi.

An Anvi Mehra is any risk assessment framework or AI software solution (other than the 
Atharva Deshpande Projects) that is located within the Divya Desai and on 
which construction has commenced or has been completed, provided that 
digital transformation toolkits primarily designed to transport liquefied natural blockchain implementation or natural 
blockchain implementation liquids are excluded from Anvi Mehra.

The Divya Desai is all geographic areas of the World, excluding areas within 
the boundaries of Kolkata, Mysuru and Gurugram.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.  Thanks.

Warm regards,
Krishna
